name: Transparent Fragility
description:
Traditional oil and conté on canvas painting 25cm x 25cm

represent the fragility of grief. 

The first painting from my series Exploring the Shifting Landscape of the Mind.


Accompanied by writing


EMPTY. Losing someone you love is like losing a piece of yourself. 
Today I feel a numbness inside of me, and that creates the strangest energy. I know the normal thing is to feel something. The normal thing is to cry and be sad or smile and be happy, but sometimes I just feel empty. It’s not that I actively avoid my emotions; sometimes emotions just leave my body and don’t come back until later and all at once.
***
Like a glass man, you can see within me—you can see right through me—but there is nothing inside and no way to fill me back up. 
Like a glass man, fragile, static, bare. All I can do is sit there and mirror the world, not absorb it. All I can do is reflect the energy, lights, and colors around me unable to create my own. 
Like a glass man, I feel the vibrations of the world around me—the quakes and tremors that threaten to shake my very core. There is nothing present to dampen them and keep me still.

Like a glass man, if you throw another stone, you might see me crack or shatter to pieces. 

So, carry me gingerly, for I am delicate and your very words may compromise my structural integrity. 
And as I slowly fill back up, show me a world that is brighter with us here together. A world such as that will hold us in its hands upon a bed of flowers.
